posts.name: Ryan
posts.cooked:
Hi all, we were trying to reimage the robot but encountered this error for the robot imaging tool. We used balena etcher to flash the sd card, inserted it into the roborio, and got to this step. We thought it might’ve been a corrupted SD card at first because we had some other errors along the way before, but we tried another without success and used rufus for flashing instead. Any suggestions are appreciated!

Screenshot 2025-02-21 142842 891×516 144 KB

Screenshot 2025-02-21 142842 891×516 144 KB

Screenshot 2025-02-21 142842 891×516 144 KB

posts.name: Omer Huly
posts.cooked: According to the docs Imaging roboRIO 2 (which I assume you have since you use an SD card) with the roboRIO Imaging Tool is not supported. You should image the SD card instead.

link_counts.title: Imaging your roboRIO 2 — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

posts.name: Ryan
posts.cooked: Yes, we imaged the SD card and followed the same steps on the docs and video.

posts.name: Omer Huly
posts.cooked: Are you encountering this error while trying to set the team number? If so, could you send an image of the Imaging Tool with the parameters before you hit apply (and the error popup covers all the info in the Imaging tool)?

posts.name: Ryan
posts.cooked:
Oh it might be an SD imaging error since nothing shows up for current image and firmare version, but we’re certain that we followed all of the steps.

Screenshot 2025-02-21 144516 887×509 71.9 KB Screenshot 2025-02-21 144508 897×512 67.8 KB

posts.name: Omer Huly
posts.cooked: Since the team number can also be set using the Team Number Setter, you can try it too (following this ). If that fails too, it might be an SD card image issue.

link_counts.title: roboRIO Team Number Setter — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

posts.name: Ryan
posts.cooked:
Thanks! The number setting doesn’t seem to be the issue but when we deploy the code we constantly get a “Build Failed” (mDNS error on console) and “Robot” on driver station never goes green.

Task :discoverroborio Discovering Target roborio admin @ roborio-10152- FRC .lan: Resolved but not connected. Reason: TimeoutException Discovery timed out. admin @ roborio-10152- FRC .local: Resolved but not connected. Reason: TimeoutException Discovery timed out. admin @ null: Resolved but not connected. Reason: TimeoutException Discovery timed out. admin @ roborio-10152- FRC .frc-field.local: Failed resolution. Reason: RuntimeException Unknown Host admin @ roborio-10152- FRC : Failed resolution. Reason: RuntimeException Unknown Host Run with --info for more details

posts.name: Thad House
posts.cooked: The number setting is the issue here. You need to have the team number set correctly in order to see the robot with the other tooling. And based on that screenshot, its not set. The name of the roborio is the default one before its set.

posts.name: Ryan
posts.cooked:
Hi, we tried using the number setter and was able to connect to the robot for a few seconds but as shown in the screenshot it quickly reverts back to roboRIO(.2)-bad. In number setter, every time we click set team to 10152, it stays at “Waiting for refresh”. I tried disabling all firewall and changed to hotspot but still receiving the same error.

posts.name: Mert Ata BABER
posts.cooked: Have you tried re-imaging? We had the exact same behaviour . Re-imaging solved it. Also why does it say Team # USB on your DS ? Have you set the team number for DS ?

posts.name: Ryan
posts.cooked: Yes, we’ve tried re-imaging the roborio multiple times. Our situation seems to be a bit different as we’re still on the usb stage rather than connection via radio.

posts.name: Mert Ata BABER
posts.cooked: Is your team number set in the DS setting ?

posts.name: Ryan
posts.cooked: Yes, it’s currently set to our team number in the settings tab.

posts.name: Jeffrey
posts.cooked:
Hi. Did you manage to solve the problem? We are experiencing the exact same issue and would appreciate any update.

Edit: Nevermind, we found the solution. There must be a radio.
